etymology.description: Old Seal Script: 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") + 日(日) (rì, "sun") = in the sun on earth -> man doing something on earth -> one who does
etymology.interpretation: The character 者(者) (zhě, "one who") combines 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") and 日(日) (rì, "sun") depicting a person standing upright on the ground, engaging in actions under the sun. This evolved to represent an agent or performer of an action.

examples.chinese: 勤奋者总能成功(勤奮者總能成功)。
学识渊博者(學識淵博者)，才能产生深远影响(才能產生深遠影響)。
examples.pinyin: xuéshí yuānbó zhě, cái néng chǎnshēng shēnyuǎn yǐngxiǎng.
examples.english: One who is knowledgeable can create far-reaching effects.

examples.chinese: 智慧者懂得自律(智慧者懂得自律)。
